item.title: Email vs. Slack
item.description: I recently visited Slack.com, and noticed that Slack is trying to position itself as a replacement for Email. This got me thinking about how Slack is different from Email. Here are some of my thoughts: At the outset, Slack enables a conversational style of communication while Email is heavily modeled on paper correspondence. Slack, and other messaging applications, do away with a lot of email overheads. There are no folders to manage, no inboxes and outboxes.
